citation.article-title: Paenibacillus pocheonensis sp. nov., a facultative anaerobe isolated from soil of a ginseng field
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus pocheonensis sp. nov.
Paenibacillus pocheonensis (po.che.on.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. pocheonensis pertaining to Pocheon Province in South Korea, the source of the soil sample from which the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-positive, motile rods, 0.5–1.0 μm in diameter and 3.0–6.0 μm in length after 2 days culture on R2A agar.
Colonies grown on R2A agar for 2 days are irregular, concentric, undulate, light yellow and convex.
Subterminal oval spores are formed in swollen sporangia.
Aerobic or facultatively anaerobic, and catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Grows at 15–30 °C, at pH 5.0–8.5 and in the presence of 2.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Growth occurs on nutrient agar and trypticase soy agar, but not on MacConkey agar.
Does not reduce nitrate to nitrite.
MK-7 is the predominant menaquinone, and anteiso-C15 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0 are the major cellular fatty acids (Supplementary Table S1).
Does not degrade xylan, cellulose, chitin, casein or DNA; other physiological characteristics are given in Table 1.
The type strain, Gsoil 1138T (=KCTC 13941T=LMG 23404T), was isolated from soil of a ginseng field in Pocheon Province, South Korea.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 52.1±0.2 mol% (mean±sd of three determinations; HPLC).
